results.title: Hard-leaved vegetation
results.creator_credit: CSIRO and Australian Academy of Science
results.brief_description: Looks at the adaptations of Australian plants to their particular environments. Covers leaves, roots and the layers in the forest.

results.title: Harambee, the world of the award
results.creator_credit: Lion Pacesetter Films, Robert Angell and Stephen Cross
results.brief_description: The Duke of Edinburgh’s Award Scheme is Commonwealth wide and it operates in forty countries. This film epitomises the spirit of the Award Scheme as shown in Kenya in 1971 when Gold Award winners from sixteen different countries gathered to learn, work and explore together.

results.title: Happy youth in sun and snow: winter holidays in Switzerland
results.brief_description: This film describes the facilities for children to learn winter sports under expert guidance. Skating, ice hockey, toboganning are shown, and training in skiing from the nursery slopes to racing is seen in some detail. No commentary, music soundtrack only.

results.title: Happy together
results.creator_credit: Block 2 Pictures, Prenom H, Seowoo, Jet Tone Production and Wong
results.brief_description: ‘Happy Together’ is a melancholy and bleak reflection on love and loneliness from acclaimed director Wong Kar-Wai. At the film’s centre is the strained romantic relationship between two men from Hong Kong who travel to South America in hope of a reconciliation. Soon enough they break up during an aborted road trip to Iguazu Falls, with both men deciding to stay on in Buenos Aires. Though they each begin separate lives, the couple retains a powerful, if reluctant connection, and when one falls victim to a harsh beating, the couple reunites, though only briefly. The film focuses almost exclusively upon the dance of alienation and togetherness behind this tumultuous relationship, with spectacular cinematography by Christopher Doyle. In Cantonese, Mandarin and Spanish with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Block 2 Pictures, Prenom H, Seowoo, Jet Tone Production and Wong

results.title: Happy to be me (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Arthur Mokin Productions and Arthur Mokin
results.brief_description: A documentary based on a survey of more than 600 students from kindergarten through high school, that provides an objective view of young people’s attitudes toward gender, or male and female roles. Candid interviews and spontaneous scenes of young people interacting at school, at play, and in the community, help create an awareness of one’s assumptions about maleness and femaleness.

results.title: Happy riding. Part 2
results.creator_credit: BBC Cymru Wales, Vis News, Euryn Ogwen-Williams and Mark Lawton
results.brief_description: Part two in the series on the art of horse riding. The topic of this film is looking after your pony. Tips on successful grooming and care are given by expert John Bateman and includes use of dandy brush, body brush, curvy comb, wisp, sponge. Use of blankets, plaiting and shoeing are also covered.

results.title: Happy riding. Part 1
results.creator_credit: BBC Cymru Wales, Vis News, Euryn Ogwen-Williams and Mark Lawton
results.brief_description: One of a series which examines the art of horse riding. This film deals with buying a pony and other aspects such as what to look for when buying a pony, horse sales, postures, fencing and shelters, feeding, equipment, stable management and veterinary reports

results.title: Happy owls
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Morton Schindel, W. Snyder and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: A pair of owls live happily together in an old ruin. One of the birds from a neighbouring farm, a peacock, observes their happiness and wonders at this achievement, as the birds he lives with are always squabbling and discontented. When the ducks, chicks and geese have congregated together the owls tell them a story illustrating the secret of their happiness. Unfortunately the birds refuse to believe or to learn. Based on the book by Celestino Piatti.

results.title: Happy locomotive
results.creator_credit: Unifilm, Baltimore and Ohio Railroad Company and Stephen Fitzgerald
results.brief_description: An animated film describing the dangers which confront an engine driver. Many of the hazards are caused by unthinking people, children and vandals. Accidents could be avoided if the public remembered simple safety rules.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Unifilm, Baltimore and Ohio Railroad Company and Stephen Fitzgerald

results.title: Happy little Vegemites = Cheap rush
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Dead Head Films and Colin Mowbray
results.brief_description: A furiously energetic short film about young homeless people who spend a night in emergency accommodation. They are bored and decide to search for some speed. When their efforts prove fruitless one of them decides that maybe a dose of vegemite might to the trick! With an excellent young cast and tight scripting, “Happy Little Vegemites” manages to be both comic, and in the scenes between the naive Gerard and the streetwise Chad, effectively touching. Features an excellent music track including Radiohead, Beasts of Bourbon and Rebecca’s Empire. Be warned, vegemite may never look the same again!
